intro: Monanthotaxis boivinii var. brevipedicellata, commonly known as the short-stemmed monanthotaxis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and unique inflorescence structure. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
